channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Fall 2024 URP Applications Now Being Accepted
item.description: The Office of Undergraduate Education is currently accepting Undergraduate Research Program (URP) applications for the Fall 2024 semester! Through the URP, full- and part-time undergraduate students may pursue research for academic credit or as a paid research assistant working in the labs of world-leading Rensselaer faculty researchers during the academic year.
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for 2024-2025 Barry Goldwater Scholarship
item.description: Established by Congress in 1986 to foster and encourage excellence in science and mathematics, the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation runs an educational scholarship program designed to provide opportunities for U.S. undergraduate students with strong academic records and outstanding research potential. The pre-application deadline is Monday, November 25, 2024; the final application deadline for nominated students is Monday, January 20, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Information Session Scheduled
item.description: Date: Friday, September 13, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - The National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship provides three years of salary and tuition while students earn a graduate degree. First- and second-year grad students and seniors who are U.S. citizens and permanent residents in 35 STEM fields are encouraged to register for this session, or to just stop by.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Working in the U.S.: CPT & Internships” Virtual Workshop to be Held for Graduate Students
item.description: Date: Thursday, September 12, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information specific to graduate students.
item.author: Students

item.title: “It’s Your Final Semester — Now What?” Topic of ISSS Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Join Rensselaer’s Office of International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the immigration options for life after graduation. Topics will include employment, continuing one’s studies, departing the U.S., and more.
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Miss the Bicentennial Campus Carnival on September 13!
item.description: In celebration of Rensselaer’s Bicentennial, the campus community is invited to come to Anderson Field from 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Friday, September 13 and join the fun at a carnival featuring a Ferris wheel, food trucks, lawn games, and more!
item.author: Community

item.title: “See What’s New in CAS SciFinder” Webinar Slated for September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - During this vendor-hosted session, CAS SciFinder experts will walk participants through recent solution enhancements, going in-depth to helping them understand how to take advantage of newly released features and the overall impact on researching in CAS SciFinder. Attend this session to see how these enhancements improve existing workflows, and ask questions specific to your research!
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Distinguished Lecture to be Held September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - During this lecture, speaker Dr. Daniel Edelstein of IBM will present “Origins and Continued Innovations Supporting the Extreme Extendibility of Cu-Based ULSI Interconnect Technology.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Former Members of Congress Coming to RPI
item.description: As part of the Congress to Campus program, Rensselaer will host a bipartisan team of two former members of Congress, welcoming the Honorable Elizabeth Esty and The Honorable John J. Faso to campus September 16-18. At 6:30 p.m. on Tuesday, September 17, both will engage with area university and high school students and take part in a community town hall at RPI’s Curtis J. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC). The town hall is free and open to the public with online registration available.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Life at the Interface of Science and Engineering” Event Scheduled for September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - This special seminar will feature a presentation titled “Escape from the Planet of the Cows” by Dr. Patrick Brown, founder of Impossible Foods. Refreshments will be served at 1:30 PM outside of the CBIS auditorium.
item.author: Community

item.title: ISATMA 2024, “Voice as Identity,” to be Held September 13-14
item.description: Date: Friday, September 13, 2024 - Sat , September 14, 2024 (all day) - EMPAC Research invites artists and scholars across all abilities to the International Symposium on Assistive Technology for Music and Art (ISATMA), featuring two days of live and hybrid performances and workshops with adaptive technologies, as well as presentations and panels in an inclusive environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting Scheduled for September 18
item.description: Join students and colleagues interested in quantum computing or those currently working on the subject at noon on Wednesday, September 18 in Amos Eaton 217. If you are interested in participating, please contact Tom Morgan.

item.title: “Viewing Summer Student Course Evaluation Results in HelioCampus” Topic of Instructor/TA Webinar
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Instructors and TAs are encouraged to register for this session, which will review how to run course evaluations results in HelioCampus and view the data in various ways.
